title: Investment Technology and Behavioral Investing
description: A comprehensive exploration of modern investment technology platforms, robo-advisors, and behavioral economics principles. Students learn to evaluate fintech tools, understand common investor biases, and develop strategies to make rational investment decisions despite psychological pitfalls.
learning_objectives: Evaluate different investment technology platforms including robo-advisors, investment apps, and online brokerages
Analyze how behavioral biases affect investment decisions and identify personal susceptibility to common errors
Compare the costs, benefits, and appropriate use cases for robo-advisors vs. DIY investing vs. financial advisors
Apply behavioral economics principles to create rules-based investment systems that counter emotional decision-making
Assess investment technology features and select appropriate tools aligned with personal financial goals and experience level

skill_builder.title: Investment Platform Evaluator
skill_builder.description: An interactive tool where students compare robo-advisors, online brokerages, and investment apps across features, costs, and suitability for different investor profiles and goals.
